summary: The Tackling Predatory Litigation Funding Act (H.R. 3512) amends the Internal Revenue Code to impose a new tax on income derived from litigation financing. This tax applies to third-party entities providing funds for litigation. The bill defines "covered parties," "litigation financing agreements," and "qualified litigation proceeds," and outlines withholding requirements. It also excludes proceeds from litigation financing agreements from the definition of capital assets and gross income and provides an effective date for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
